alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Indiana (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN INDIANA AND SOUTHEASTERN ARMSTRONG COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 800 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles northwest of Indiana, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Rural Valley, Dayton, Marion Center, Elderton, Creekside, Plumville, Shelocta, Atwood, and Smicksburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
